author: n3rdopolis
body:
Hi

Looking at the source, I found that there are some demos for systemd, where the path is capitalized incorrectly

It is spelled as 'SystemD' in the given locations, where to the systemd documentations, this is incorrect https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/systemd/ . furthermore, the capitalization format 'SystemD', is in fact used by many folks who tend to mock the init system.



```
demos/DSC/dsc-demo.ps1:    $ServiceCtl = "SystemD"
demos/SystemD/journalctl-demo.ps1:Import-Module $PSScriptRoot/SystemD/SystemD.psm1
demos/SystemD/journalctl-demo.ps1:Write-Host -Foreground Blue "Get recent SystemD journal messages"
demos/SystemD/journalctl-demo.ps1:#Drill into SystemD unit messages
demos/SystemD/journalctl-demo.ps1:Write-Host -Foreground Blue "Get recent SystemD journal messages for services and return Unit, Message"
demos/SystemD/readme.md:## SystemD: journalctl demo
demos/SystemD/readme.md:- Requires a SystemD-based operating system (Red Hat or CentOS 7, Ubuntu 16.04)
demos/SystemD/readme.md:Note: Accessing the SystemD journal requires privileges. The user must have authorization to elevate with sudo. You will be prompted for a sudo
```

Thanks
